Description: The Set-NetIPv6Protocol cmdlet modifies the global IPv6 protocol configuration for a computer. If you do not specify any parameters for the cmdlet, the cmdlet sets the default values for the IPv6 protocol configuration.

Examples.Title: Example 1: Enable the DHCP Media Sense event log
Examples.Code:
PS C:\>Set-NetIPv6Protocol –MediaSenseEventLog Enabled
This command enables the DHCP Media Sense event log.

Examples.Title: Example 2: Increase the number of neighbors
Examples.Code:
PS C:\>Set-NetIPv6Protocol –NeighborCacheLimitEntries 1000
This command increases the size of the cache of on-link neighbors on the subnet to 1,000. The default value is 256.
